qas.question: What is the main methodist educational institution in Uruguay?
When was the Montevideo Crandon Institute founded?
What is the first academic institution in South America where a home economics course was taught?

context: <a0_0>The Montevideo Crandon Institute<a0_0/> is an American School of missionary origin and the main Methodist educational institution in Uruguay. Founded in <a1_0>1879<a1_0/> and supported by the Women's Society of the Methodist Church of the United States, it is one of the most traditional and emblematic institutions in the city inculcating John Wesley's values. Its alumni include presidents, senators, ambassadors and Nobel Prize winners, along with musicians, scientists, and others. <a2_0>The Montevideo Crandon Institute<a2_0/> boasts of being the first academic institution in South America where a home economics course was taught.
